page.title: 05WERRINGTON ESTATE
page.content: Werrington Mansion is surrounded by parklands.In this estate are woods,parklands a river and a cultivated garden.In the garden are many shrubs and uncommon species of trees such as Abies Squamata,which have become very famous.Within the grounds there is a farm called Ham Mill which was the home farm but is now let to a tenant.There are on the estate large numbers of pheasants which are bred in the area called the Cockpit.This area was used for cock-fighting in the eighteenth century.About 2,500 to 3,000 pheasants are bred each yearand about 60 to 120 woodcock are brought in during the pheasant shooting.The area was used for rabbit breeding but myxamatosis has decimated them.The Lamerton Foxhounds meet every February outside the house.
